00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * Helper functions to abstract SFP and QSFP connectors
00044  *
00045  * <hr>$Revision: 146313 $<hr>
00046  */
00047 #ifndef __CVMX_HELPER_SFP_H__
00048 #define __CVMX_HELPER_SFP_H__
00049 
00050 #ifdef __cplusplus
00051 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00052 extern "C" {
00053 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00054 #endif
00055 
00056 /**
00057  * Maximum size for the SFP EEPROM.  Currently only 96 bytes are used.
00058  */
00059 #define CVMX_SFP_MAX_EEPROM_SIZE    0x100
00060 
00061 /**
00062  * Default address of sfp EEPROM
00063  */
00064 #define CVMX_SFP_DEFAULT_I2C_ADDR   0x50
00065 
00066 /**
00067  * Default address of SFP diagnostics chip
00068  */
00069 #define CVMX_SFP_DEFAULT_DIAG_I2C_ADDR  0x51
00070 
00071 struct cvmx_fdt_sfp_info;
00072 struct cvmx_fdt_gpio_info;
00073 /**
00074  * Connector type for module, usually we only see SFP and QSFPP
00075  */
00076 enum cvmx_phy_sfp_conn_type {
00077     CVMX_SFP_CONN_SFP = 0x03,       /** SFP/SFP+/SFP28 */
00078     CVMX_SFP_CONN_QSFP = 0x0C,      /** 1G QSFP (obsolete) */
00079     CVMX_SFP_CONN_QSFPP = 0x0D,     /** QSFP+ or later */
00080     CVMX_SFP_CONN_QSFP28 = 0x11,        /** QSFP28 (100Gbps) */
00081     CVMX_SFP_CONN_MICRO_QSFP = 0x17,    /** Micro QSFP */
00082 };
00083 
00084 /**
00085  * module type plugged into a SFP/SFP+/QSFP+ port
00086  */
00087 enum cvmx_phy_sfp_mod_type {
00088     CVMX_SFP_MOD_UNKNOWN = 0,       /** Unknown or unspecified */
00089     /** Fiber optic module (LC connector) */
00090     CVMX_SFP_MOD_OPTICAL_LC = 0x7,
00091     /** Fiber optic module (pigtail, no connector) */
00092     CVMX_SFP_MOD_OPTICAL_PIGTAIL = 0xB,
00093     CVMX_SFP_MOD_COPPER_PIGTAIL = 0x21, /** copper module */
00094     CVMX_SFP_MOD_RJ45 = 0x22,       /** RJ45 (i.e. 10GBase-T) */
00095     /** No separable connector (SFP28/copper) */
00096     CVMX_SFP_MOD_NO_SEP_CONN = 0x23,
00097     /** Unknown/other module type */
00098     CVMX_SFP_MOD_OTHER
00099 };
00100 
00101 /** Peak rate supported by SFP cable */
00102 enum cvmx_phy_sfp_rate {
00103     CVMX_SFP_RATE_UNKNOWN,      /** Unknown rate */
00104     CVMX_SFP_RATE_1G,       /** 1Gbps */
00105     CVMX_SFP_RATE_10G,      /** 10Gbps */
00106     CVMX_SFP_RATE_25G,      /** 25Gbps */
00107     CVMX_SFP_RATE_40G,      /** 40Gbps */
00108     CVMX_SFP_RATE_100G      /** 100Gbps */
00109 };
00110 
00111 /**
00112  * Cable compliance specification
00113  * See table 4-4 from SFF-8024 for the extended specification compliance codes
00114  */
00115 enum cvmx_phy_sfp_cable_ext_compliance {
00116     CVMX_SFP_CABLE_UNSPEC = 0,
00117     CVMX_SFP_CABLE_100G_AOC_HIGH_BER = 0x01,    /** Active optical cable */
00118     CVMX_SFP_CABLE_100G_SR4 = 0x2,
00119     CVMX_SFP_CABLE_100G_LR4 = 0x3,
00120     CVMX_SFP_CABLE_100G_ER4 = 0x4,
00121     CVMX_SFP_CABLE_100G_SR10 = 0x5,
00122     CVMX_SFP_CABLE_100G_CWDM4_MSA = 0x6,
00123     CVMX_SFP_CABLE_100G_PSM4 = 0x7,
00124     CVMX_SFP_CABLE_100G_ACC_HIGH_BER = 0x8,
00125     CVMX_SFP_CABLE_100G_CWDM4 = 0x9,
00126     CVMX_SFP_CABLE_100G_CR4 = 0xA,
00127     CVMX_SFP_CABLE_25G_CR_CA_S = 0xC,
00128     CVMX_SFP_CABLE_25G_CR_CA_N = 0xD,
00129     CVMX_SFP_CABLE_40G_ER4 = 0x10,
00130     CVMX_SFP_CABLE_4X10G_SR = 0x11,
00131     CVMX_SFP_CABLE_40G_PSM4= 0x12,
00132     CVMX_SFP_CABLE_G959_1_P1I1_2D1 = 0x13,
00133     CVMX_SFP_CABLE_G959_1_P1S1_2D2 = 0x14,
00134     CVMX_SFP_CABLE_G959_1_P1L1_2D2 = 0x15,
00135     CVMX_SFP_CABLE_10GBASE_T = 0x16,
00136     CVMX_SFP_CABLE_100G_CLR4 = 0x17,
00137     CVMX_SFP_CABLE_100G_AOC_LOW_BER = 0x18,
00138     CVMX_SFP_CABLE_100G_ACC_LOW_BER = 0x19,
00139     CVMX_SFP_CABLE_100G_2_LAMBDA_DWDM = 0x1a
00140 };
00141 
00142 /** Optical modes module is compliant with */
00143 enum cvmx_phy_sfp_10g_eth_compliance {
00144     CVMX_SFP_CABLE_10GBASE_ER = 0x80,   /** 10G ER */
00145     CVMX_SFP_CABLE_10GBASE_LRM = 0x40,  /** 10G LRM */
00146     CVMX_SFP_CABLE_10GBASE_LR = 0x20,   /** 10G LR */
00147     CVMX_SFP_CABLE_10GBASE_SR = 0x10    /** 10G SR */
00148 };
00149 
00150 /** Diagnostic ASIC compatiblity */
00151 enum cvmx_phy_sfp_sff_8472_diag_rev {
00152     CVMX_SFP_SFF_8472_NO_DIAG = 0x00,
00153     CVMX_SFP_SFF_8472_REV_9_3 = 0x01,
00154     CVMX_SFP_SFF_8472_REV_9_5 = 0x02,
00155     CVMX_SFP_SFF_8472_REV_10_2 = 0x03,
00156     CVMX_SFP_SFF_8472_REV_10_4 = 0x04,
00157     CVMX_SFP_SFF_8472_REV_11_0 = 0x05,
00158     CVMX_CVMX_SFP_SFF_8472_REV_11_3 = 0x06,
00159     CVMX_SFP_SFF_8472_REV_11_4 = 0x07,
00160     CVMX_SFP_SFF_8472_REV_12_0 = 0x08,
00161     CVMX_SFP_SFF_8472_REV_UNALLOCATED = 0xff
00162 };
00163 
00164 /**
00165  * Data structure describing the current SFP or QSFP EEPROM
00166  */
00167 struct cvmx_sfp_mod_info {
00168     enum cvmx_phy_sfp_conn_type conn_type;  /** Connector type */
00169     enum cvmx_phy_sfp_mod_type mod_type;    /** Module type */
00170     enum cvmx_phy_sfp_rate rate;        /** Rate of module */
00171     /** 10G Ethernet Compliance codes (logical OR) */
00172     enum cvmx_phy_sfp_10g_eth_compliance eth_comp;
00173     /** Extended Cable compliance */
00174     enum cvmx_phy_sfp_cable_ext_compliance cable_comp;
00175     uint8_t vendor_name[17];        /** Mopdule vendor name */
00176     uint8_t vendor_oui[3];          /** vendor OUI */
00177     uint8_t vendor_pn[17];          /** Vendor part number */
00178     uint8_t vendor_rev[5];          /** Vendor revision */
00179     uint8_t vendor_sn[17];          /** Vendor serial number */
00180     uint8_t date_code[9];           /** Date code */
00181     bool valid;             /** True if module is valid */
00182     bool active_cable;          /** False for passive copper */
00183     bool copper_cable;          /** True if cable is copper */
00184     /** True if module is limiting (i.e. not passive copper) */
00185     bool limiting;
00186     /** Maximum length of copper cable in meters */
00187     int max_copper_cable_len;
00188     /** Max single mode cable length in meters */
00189     int max_single_mode_cable_length;
00190     /** Max 50um OM2 cable length */
00191     int max_50um_om2_cable_length;
00192     /** Max 62.5um OM1 cable length */
00193     int max_62_5um_om1_cable_length;
00194     /** Max 50um OM4 cable length */
00195     int max_50um_om4_cable_length;
00196     /** Max 50um OM3 cable length */
00197     int max_50um_om3_cable_length;
00198     /** Minimum bitrate in Mbps */
00199     int bitrate_min;
00200     /** Maximum bitrate in Mbps */
00201     int bitrate_max;
00202     /**
00203      * Set to true if forward error correction is required,
00204      * for example, a 25GBase-CR CA-S cable.
00205      *
00206      * FEC should only be disabled at 25G with CA-N cables.  FEC is required
00207      * with 5M and longer cables.
00208      */
00209     bool fec_required;
00210     /** True if RX output is linear */
00211     bool linear_rx_output;
00212     /** Power level, can be 1, 2 or 3 */
00213     int power_level;
00214     /** False if conventional cooling is used, true for active cooling */
00215     bool cooled_laser;
00216     /** True if internal retimer or clock and data recovery circuit */
00217     bool internal_cdr;
00218     /** True if LoS is implemented */
00219     bool los_implemented;
00220     /** True if LoS is inverted from the standard */
00221     bool los_inverted;
00222     /** True if TX_FAULT is implemented */
00223     bool tx_fault_implemented;
00224     /** True if TX_DISABLE is implemented */
00225     bool tx_disable_implemented;
00226     /** True if RATE_SELECT is implemented */
00227     bool rate_select_implemented;
00228     /** True if tuneable transmitter technology is used */
00229     bool tuneable_transmitter;
00230     /** True if receiver decision threshold is implemented */
00231     bool rx_decision_threshold_implemented;
00232     /** True if diagnostic monitoring present */
00233     bool diag_monitoring;
00234     /** True if diagnostic address 0x7f is used for selecting the page */
00235     bool diag_paging;
00236     /** Diagnostic feature revision */
00237     enum cvmx_phy_sfp_sff_8472_diag_rev diag_rev;
00238     /** True if an address change sequence is required for diagnostics */
00239     bool diag_addr_change_required;
00240     /** True if RX power is averaged, false if OMA */
00241     bool diag_rx_power_averaged;
00242     /** True if diagnostics are externally calibrated */
00243     bool diag_externally_calibrated;
00244     /** True if diagnostics are internally calibrated */
00245     bool diag_internally_calibrated;
00246     /** True of soft rate select control implemented per SFF-8431 */
00247     bool diag_soft_rate_select_control;
00248     /** True if application select control implemented per SFF-8079 */
00249     bool diag_app_select_control;
00250     /** True if soft RATE_SELECT control and moonitoring implemented */
00251     bool diag_soft_rate_select_implemented;
00252     /** True if soft RX_LOS monitoring implemented */
00253     bool diag_soft_rx_los_implemented;
00254     /** True if soft TX_FAULT monitoring implemented */
00255     bool diag_soft_tx_fault_implemented;
00256     /** True if soft TX_DISABLE control and monitoring implemented */
00257     bool diag_soft_tx_disable_implemented;
00258     /** True if alarm/warning flags implemented */
00259     bool diag_alarm_warning_flags_implemented;
00260 };
00261 
00262 /**
00263  * Reads the SFP EEPROM using the i2c bus
00264  *
00265  * @param[out]  buffer      Buffer to store SFP EEPROM data in
00266  *              The buffer should be SFP_MAX_EEPROM_SIZE bytes.
00267  * @param   i2c_bus     i2c bus number to read from for SFP port
00268  * @param   i2c_addr    i2c address to use, 0 for default
00269  *
00270  * @return  -1 if invalid bus or i2c read error, 0 for success
00271  */
00272 int cvmx_phy_sfp_read_i2c_eeprom(uint8_t *buffer, int i2c_bus, int i2c_addr);
00273 
00274 /**
00275  * Reads the SFP/SFP+/QSFP EEPROM and outputs the type of module or cable
00276  * plugged in
00277  *
00278  * @param[out]  sfp_info    Info about SFP module
00279  * @param[in]   buffer      SFP EEPROM buffer to parse
00280  *
00281  * @return  0 on success, -1 if error reading EEPROM or if EEPROM corrupt
00282  */
00283 int cvmx_phy_sfp_parse_eeprom(struct cvmx_sfp_mod_info *sfp_info,
00284                   const uint8_t *buffer);
00285 
00286 /**
00287  * Prints out information about a SFP/QSFP device
00288  *
00289  * @param[in]   sfp_info    data structure to print
00290  */
00291 void cvmx_phy_sfp_print_info(const struct cvmx_sfp_mod_info *sfp_info);
00292 
00293 /**
00294  * Reads and parses SFP/QSFP EEPROM
00295  *
00296  * @param   sfp sfp handle to read
00297  *
00298  * @return  0 for success, -1 on error.
00299  */
00300 int cvmx_sfp_read_i2c_eeprom(struct cvmx_fdt_sfp_info *sfp);
00301 
00302 /**
00303  * Function called to check and return the status of the mod_abs pin or
00304  * mod_pres pin for QSFPs.
00305  *
00306  * @param   sfp Handle to SFP information.
00307  * @param   data    User-defined data passed to the function
00308  *
00309  * @return  0 if absent, 1 if present, -1 on error
00310  */
00311 int cvmx_sfp_check_mod_abs(struct cvmx_fdt_sfp_info *sfp, void *data);
00312 
00313 /**
00314  * Registers a function to be called to check mod_abs/mod_pres for a SFP/QSFP
00315  * slot.
00316  *
00317  * @param   sfp     Handle to SFP data structure
00318  * @param   check_mod_abs   Function to be called or NULL to remove
00319  * @param   mod_abs_data    User-defined data to be passed to check_mod_abs
00320  *
00321  * @return  0 for success
00322  */
00323 int cvmx_sfp_register_check_mod_abs(struct cvmx_fdt_sfp_info *sfp,
00324     int (*check_mod_abs)(struct cvmx_fdt_sfp_info *sfp, void *data),
00325     void *mod_abs_data);
00326 
00327 /**
00328  * Registers a function to be called whenever the mod_abs/mod_pres signal
00329  * changes.
00330  *
00331  * @param   sfp     Handle to SFP data structure
00332  * @param   mod_abs_changed Function called whenever mod_abs is changed
00333  *              or NULL to remove.
00334  * @param   mod_abs_changed_data    User-defined data passed to
00335  *                  mod_abs_changed
00336  *
00337  * @return  0 for success
00338  */
00339 int cvmx_sfp_register_mod_abs_changed(struct cvmx_fdt_sfp_info *sfp,
00340     int (*mod_abs_changed)(struct cvmx_fdt_sfp_info *sfp, int val,
00341                    void *data),
00342     void *mod_abs_changed_data);
00343 
00344 /**
00345  * Registers a function to be called whenever rx_los changes
00346  *
00347  * @param   sfp     Handle to SFP data structure
00348  * @param   rx_los_changed  Function to be called when rx_los changes
00349  *              or NULL to remove the function
00350  * @param   rx_los_changed_data User-defined data passed to
00351  *                  rx_los_changed
00352  *
00353  * @return  0 for success
00354  */
00355 int cvmx_sfp_register_rx_los_changed(struct cvmx_fdt_sfp_info *sfp,
00356     int (*rx_los_changed)(struct cvmx_fdt_sfp_info *sfp, int val,
00357                   void *data),
00358     void *rx_los_changed_data);
00359 
00360 /**
00361  * Parses the device tree for SFP and QSFP slots
00362  *
00363  * @param   fdt_addr    Address of flat device-tree
00364  *
00365  * @return  0 for success, -1 on error
00366  */
00367 int cvmx_sfp_parse_device_tree(void *fdt_addr);
00368 
00369 /**
00370  * Given an IPD port number find the corresponding SFP or QSFP slot
00371  *
00372  * @param   ipd_port    IPD port number to search for
00373  *
00374  * @return  pointer to SFP data structure or NULL if not found
00375  */
00376 struct cvmx_fdt_sfp_info *cvmx_sfp_find_slot_by_port(int ipd_port);
00377 
00378 /**
00379  * Given a fdt node offset find the corresponding SFP or QSFP slot
00380  *
00381  * @param   of_offset   flat device tree node offset
00382  *
00383  * @return  pointer to SFP data structure or NULL if not found
00384  */
00385 struct cvmx_fdt_sfp_info *cvmx_sfp_find_slot_by_fdt_node(int of_offset);
